text: Franz Ruff (1906 in Straubing - 1979 in Prien am Chiemsee) was a minor architect during the National Socialist regime in Germany, the son of Ludwig Ruff and responsible for completing the Nuremberg Party Congress Hall after his father's death in 1934. ==See also== * Nazi architecture ==External links== * Congress Hall Category:20th-century German architects Category:Architects in the Nazi Party Category:1906 births Category:1979 deaths Category:People from Straubing
title: Franz Ruff
